newsitem.title: UK: First Choice summer bookings up six pct.
newsitem.headline: First Choice summer bookings up six pct.

text.p: British tour operator First Choice Holidays Plc said on Thursday bookings for this summer were six percent higher at June 21 this year compared with last year.
The company said net margins had improved for the period, while load factors were considerably higher.
"Overall trading performance for this summer is in line with expectations," First Choice said in its first-half earnings statement.
The company's loss narrowed to 22.8 million stg for the six months to April 30 from 23.4 million a year earlier, excluding a charge of 8.6 million stg in the current period.
First Choice said it took the charge due to accounting errors made in prior periods.
The company added that the charge did not hurt its cash position or current year trading.
"We have reorganised and strengthened the financial control function and recruited new personnel," it said.
First Choice's shares were marked up 1.0p at 94 by 0730 GMT.
Regarding its outlook, the company said bookings to date in the UK were 18 percent ahead for winter 1997/98, with margins also signicantly improved.
The company also said it was encouraged by bookings for next summer.
"We are confident of continued improvement in profitability arising from the greater focus on managing the core businesses," the firm said.
